Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, children, now that I have completed this book, which is the last of the science of medicine, for the completion of which I have attained its end, and through its explanations and declarations, it is evident to me that I complete for you here this treatise, which is part of my surgical operations.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the operation of surgery is well established in our region and in our time, yet it remains largely private, despite the importance of its science and the clarity of its principles. Only a few brief descriptions can be found in the works of the Ancients, which correct many errors and hesitations, but the understanding of it is limited, and its force and art are diluted.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it is clear to me that I should vivify that order in this treatise according to the way of explanation and declaration and abbreviation; so that it comes into line with the forms of the instruments of cautery and other tools of the work through the addition of declaration and preparation, which is necessary for these causes.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	More the reason why a good craftsman does not use his hand well in this our time is because the art of medicine is long and that its actor before this had to be exercised in the science of anatomy which Gualia knew entering into which he understood the youth of the members and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and had knowledge of the bones, the nerves, and the sinews, their number, and their texture; and of the veins pulsating and the quiet ones, and the places of the movement of them.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this, Hippocrates is said to name the hand as primary, more in the small work, and most of all in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	More over, we have already spoken of this in the introduction to this book; for whoever does not know what we said about anatomy, will fall into error on account of which many men will die, as I have seen too many of those. For some are formed in this science and go from there to another science and its experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For you saw a foolish and inexperienced doctor who incurred an apostematia scrophulosa in the neck of a woman, and damaged some arteries so that much blood flowed, and the woman died among her many sufferings.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And there was another doctor who almost drained a stone from a man who had been suffering for a long time, and the stone was large, and it came to him, and he removed that stone with a piece of the bladder, so that that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I have already called for the stone to be extracted, and I see that due to the size of the stone and the position of the patient, he will likely die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And there was another doctor who took a stipend from a duke of our land for surgery, and he came upon a black servant who had a fracture in the thigh; and due to the doctor's ignorance, he extracted the fracture, placing it over the wound with cushions and splints of strong structure, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then the dislocation according to his desires, and then the reattachment, and then the leaving for a few days as commanded that we release the ligament; and thus remain until the thigh and foot heal properly, and proceed to recovery.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and prepared to untie the bandage, and peace and an attempt to alleviate his pains was achieved.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But still, as the corruption was confirmed in the member, I could not refrain from stopping that, and did not cease to wander the corruption in the member while the illness persisted.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And there was another doctor who incised an oncotic abscess, and it ulcerated for several days, during which its malignity grew significantly to the detriment of its lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause is that the pain is purely from melancholic humors, and does not affect everything completely, but rather affects a member that suffers from being attacked by all.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, my children, it is necessary for you that the operation be devised in two ways: one where the operation is associated with health, and another where the work is risky in the major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already existed here in all parts of this libretto where the operation is full of error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to keep this and leave that, so that the leaves do not find a way to speak and to disgrace you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take your weapons with diligence and protection of God, and your patients with felicity and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way by the grace of God seeking salvation and praiseworthy success, and lay aside the terrible illnesses difficult to cure, and keep your weapons against what makes you fear, so that sitting in your faith and in your name you are not betrayed: for more remains to your glory, and more in this world and beyond to your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gout is already dissected in some monastic works:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat illness falsely, so that bad doctors will not be named.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already devoted this livre according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the livre, and first with the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered in the head of the foot, on the forms of the instruments and on the tools of the cautery, and on what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on dryness and perforation, and on suction cups, and on boils, and on the extraction of arrows and similar, all categorized and organized by the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the cure of sprains and similar conditions; a chapter organized by the head between the feet, and by the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On the cautery with fire and with sharp medical tools, and a reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that, we begin the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I will describe the qualities of the cautery and its ingredients, and in which conditions the use of a cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the discourse on the quality of the cautery's juice and its ingredients is long and tedious, subtle through science, and a hidden secret; many wise men have already spoken extensively about it, and they are in disagreement. For my part, I content myself with a small portion of their sermons, fearing excessive length.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And thus it is said that the cautery benefits all conjunctions universally which are of flesh or sinew, except two conjunctions, which are joint connections of sinew.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the joint of the leg and foot, which are of flesh, they will dry up; for some said that the cautery is beneficial for that, while others said the opposite, that the cautery is not suitable in disease which is due to quality and dryness, for the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inappropriate that a disease which is of flesh and dry should be healed by what is cautery and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And you dismiss those who say the opposite, that by cautery one is cured in all joint disease and foot disease that comes in men's bodies, for when you compare man's body and its humors to the nature of fire, you find man's body to be dry.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say according to that speech, for I have already experienced this several times myself.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	Yet I do not consider that it comes to this that one who is already experienced in the practice of cautery through long exercise in the Capitol, and who knows the diversity of human joints and the disposition of diseases in their various forms, as well as the causes of those diseases, and the accidents related to them, and the duration of those diseases.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other complications, it is not about your fear, and especially in the wet diseases, for all doctors are agreed upon those, and they do not differ in applying cautery to them in youth.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, of the secret of curing by cautery with fire and of its goodness, concerning the cautery in medicine that burns, for the fire is simple, and its action reaches only the member being cauterized and causes no harm to other members when properly applied.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	And the action of the burning medicine reaches that part in the members where it touches, and strongly makes come into the affected member a disease that is difficult to heal and quickly affects it.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	And fire, by its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does not cause anything but to evaporate excess. We are already well aware of this through experience and a long service of studying the art regarding the true causes; and for this reason, I excuse myself for the length of my discourse. If it were not that this matter is not written freely in this pause, and if you had not kept your secret about fire, its quality in operations on bodies, and how you expel diseases through its expulsion, I would have spoken philosophically demonstratively, which would have been appropriate for your ears.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, sons, that they disagree about the time at which it is convenient to make a cautery and when the best season is spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that a cautery is convenient at all times, because the damage caused by accidental timing is submerged in the youthfulness of what is seared by the cautery, and especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong boils, which do not tolerate delay due to fear of those caused by evil intent, which are greater than minor damage entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this is not done on your feet, or, sons, they do not consider it other than the common people and the foolish doctors, since for that illness which is cured by cautery it is not convenient at all times, and they pause that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not thus because they consider it so, for a cautery is not other than in place of a medicine which alters the composition and dries the humors which are the cause of the venous pains.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Yet, however, a cautery in excess over medicine for the swiftness of its efficacy and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that the patient's illness may return at some point in time, depending on the complexity of the ailment, its location, and its nature, as well as what has been prepared in the body through the accumulation of superfluities within it, or what has been acquired in the body through foods and similar causes; but if the ailment where a cautery is administered is a subtle illness in a member with few superfluities and humidities, such as a dental cautery for pain and similar conditions to that one, it is possible that no pain will return in it, but this is done in small amounts.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	It is more common to say that a cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a direct remedy, not as much as what we understand by it, for I believe it is not a cure that benefits either from medicine or from any other cause except the cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The cause is the opposite; and I understand that a cautery is the last remedy of medicine only when one has tried all methods of cure for certain ailments, and those medicines have not been effective, and then, at the end of the treatment, one administers a cautery, which benefits in that case.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And at this point from here begin the last remedies of medicine, not according to the understanding which I understand of the vulgar and too many of the foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that a gold cautery is better than an iron one, and they would not say this only because of the equality of gold and the sublimity of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place for cautery does not burn, since it is not absolutely verified, for I have already tried this and found that it works only in some bodies and not in others. A gold cautery is good and better than iron as they say; but when you make a cautery with fire of gold, it is not determined to you, because it ignites according to the quantity you want due to the hardness of the gold, and prepares to receive fire; and if you adjust over the ignition, the gold melts by the fire, and settles in the fire with some sheets so that the artisan can cut through its occupation.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this, you should make the cautery with iron more lightly and more precisely in terms of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on the cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the thigh between the feet, so that I delay the asking for what he wants.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of the cautery for head pain due to cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery addresses the cold and humidity over the servel accident of which there are two causes, these being the cause of soda and much traumatic flux, called corissa, from the head to the parts of the neck and the ears flowing, and much sleeping, and tooth pain, and colic, and generally all illness that comes through cold, thus as paralysis, soda, and apoplexy, and similar symptoms in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is as follows: first, you command the patient to be evacuated with a mild purgative for the head for three or four nights, according to the virtue of the patient and their age and habit.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command that his head be shaved, and place the shaver between your hands on a tilted bench and have his hands rest on his own feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the razor from your palm near the mouth between the patient's palms.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	More over, since the correct location has been determined, mark that location with a needle, and then heat the olive cautery of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place the heated cautery over the marked location with a needle, in such a way that it descends slowly, with your hand gradually pressing it down, and you rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand slightly and look at the location, and if you see any part of the bone being revealed, as much as a grain of millet, then lift your hand. If not, return your hand to that iron, or another one if it is cooled, so that what I have said can be seen on the bone.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little of salt, dissolve it in that [liquid], and leave it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place yourself over the wound in the boge (leg) and leave it there until the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the place with ointment of tetrafarmacon until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And we have said that when the wound is opened wide, it heals better, because it is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the condyle should be cauteryed within the bone, and that the cautery should be left in until a part of the bone's surface is adhered.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then scrape away what is adhered to the bone, and then cure it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that the cautery should reach the marrow, pressing forcefully into the bone until it cools, and this is Alphécourt's method.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they estimate from that place exhale the vapors of the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And let the wound remain open for a long time, and only then be treated when it is healed.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two types of cautery for all, only in some men according to fear; leave that one, I advise you, it is better for health when it is; for the head is developed by solution of continuity of the head as we have testified in other members, and especially when the head of the patient is of cold nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and better, I advise you; use that one and do that for health.
Capitol segon.	Capitulate second.
Del cauteri del cap.	On the cautery for the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in the whole head there occurs chronic and long-lasting pain that is prolonged in the patient, and he uses garters, cohorns, cap purges, plasters, poultices, pillows, bandages, and face masks, and especially if the head has already been cauterized with a cautery which does not improve his condition from any of those causes, then consider whether the head of the patient is of strong constitution in its nature; and if it is not cold or shows no great pain, then that cautery should be replaced by another.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that on the top of his head between where the seam has split.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Incise the seam and uncover the quantity which we have counted, and cauterize that with a cautery at the rear part of the head in the place which is called vas, — and this is the place where suction is applied.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And raise your hand here, but do not uncover the skull, for the patient finds great pain from this different from the pain of all other head cautery treatments.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I shall say this cautery in its place, for know that the cautery on which we cauterize the horns of the head and the occiput is a finer cautery than that on which the middle part of the head is cauterized; and this is the form of it.
Capitol ters.	Head, top.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the cautery treatment for old migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is a sharp pain in the rear part of the head, or a dull pain between the temples, the head should be treated with medicines that purify the brain, and the other treatment I have described for diseases should be administered; and if this does not help, then the cautery treatment can be performed in two ways: either with a sharp burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	May a cautery in medicine that burns be that you take a piece of alder, incinerate it, and abridge the extremities of it from both ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then apply the place of the pain in the temple with a lancet laid into it, where you make the incision and leave the needle, which is to be concealed.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then strengthen over the place stopped by descending constriction, and leave it for the space of three hours; and then remove and draw the alder, and leave the wound for two or three days, and then cover over the spot submerge in balm until the area heals.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do what with some burning medicines which I have written in the second treatise of burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	May the cautery be performed according to this manner: ignite the cautery from which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a clavicle, for its head has the form of a nail and in the middle part there is a small prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then place your hand over the location of the pain, and retract it—so that the artery which is left is not burned—and slowly rotate the small iron bit.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount that is burned due to the strength of the cautery is as great as its size, lift your hand so that the artery is not burned which is left, so that there be no flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then immerse it in salt water and place it over the area, leaving it for three days. Then place it near a warm fire, and cure it with ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you do, cauterize at the end of the knife edge according to the cautery, and beware of cutting the artery in this not very ancient migraine.
Capitol quart.	Capitol quarter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cautery for ancient headache.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you cure a headache as we have said in the previous cure and as we have said in the divisions of diseases, and the cure does not help, and sometimes because the disease is worse than what we have said about the first cautery by medicine or the cautery by fire, then you must heat the surgical cautery until it is white-hot. Place your hand on the place of the pain along the length where the greatest part of the said lies, or just above it; and after that, for a moment, firmly press that area to make the artery incise and penetrate into the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, you must guard against the continuation of the jaw, which is weakened and should not be used for chewing, and ensure that the nerve which affects it is not adhered to, and that no spasm occurs.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it concerns the care and caution regarding the flow of blood from the artery that is incised, for in its incision there is fear, especially for one who ignores what he does and is not studious or careful; and leaves the operation at its beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will recall the regulation concerning the flow of blood incident to the artery according to its manner, in this place of this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see this illness in the patient that does not tolerate this cautery and you see the body of the patient tolerable, cauterize it in the middle of the foot as we have reported, and cure the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent. De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cautery for pains in the ears.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear due to cold and it is treated with conservative methods and another treatment as I have said in the division, and the pain is not relieved, then apply the cautery, which is called the puncta. This is its form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna. Capitol .vi.	Capitol. vi.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of cautery for the tortura.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Tortura which is cured and treated with cautery is none other than due to the qualities of the wind, as we have said in the divisions of the ailments.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cautery for the quality that causes dryness or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you cure that quality of tortura with jerras, capipurgi, and guarismes, and find your cure ineffective, then when you treat the malady with three cauteries: the first on the ear, the second a small prick in its temple, and the third on the conjunction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery on the opposite side of the malformed part, for softening occurs only in the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cautery is to apply the cautery at the outer part of the ear near the top of the ear, and above a small area on the crown of the head, and elsewhere on the temple, the length of which should be according to the length of the affected part, and then place your hand over the area where the quantity of the scab has been burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the method of the cautery, and it is the specialty of the surgeon, the form of whose practice is described below.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	Yet more subtle is that you use just a small amount, as if seen; and cover it with a small piece to avoid unnecessary coarseness.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then cover the area with what is described and let it heal properly.

Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cautery treatment for nasal odor.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When your treatment for the condition as described in the division does not improve, then you prepare and give to drink to the patient three times the decoction of cochias; and cut his hair, and cautery him with a medium-sized cautery and an olive wood cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cautery that area with a sharp cautery on both hairlines, leaving the hair slightly.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to scorch that area.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And the use of the sharp cautery is as follows.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the cautery for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by illness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery, and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, cauterize that over the two eyebrows with a small one on each side, and let them be long from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery according to the size of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but according to the amount that the inner part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Capitol. XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of the cautery of the eyelid of the eye when the skin is converted in the inner parts and fistula of the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the eye is converted in the inner parts, I probe the eye, and cauterize there according to two methods: either by cautery or by applying burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If the cautery is from fire, command the patient to lie down in such a way that his skin is exposed as if those who bathe him do, with their hands extended and equal; and when you hold it there, strengthen the edges of it with a bandage so that it does not become inflamed before the skin is grown over it.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then, when the skin is grown over and extended, place the head of the patient on a pillow, and then press your hand over the edges of the cautery tentatively, marking it in the shape of a laurel leaf, which will be the beginning of the mark on the skin.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then place it carefully immersed in oil or mustard on the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then heat the cautery of which this is the form.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Then apply the cautery to the marked figure, gradually in small stages, until the surface of the wound is burned, which should appear like a laurel leaf, entirely visible and proper.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And a sign of the healthiness of your work is that you see the eyelid of the heel already contracted and the hairs of it raised from the puncture of the heel.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And therefore raise your hand and leave it there for three days, and place it over the wound between that the scar is eradicated.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if it returns through the skin for some cause near their origin and the eyelid becomes softened, then make another time the cautery over that, all as you have done first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the skin is in the eyelid, then cauterize that when it is raised to its natural place and made equal, so that the skin does not cover the heel.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicine is that you command the patient to lengthen and make equal the skin, and then form it into the shape of a mulberry leaf using a piece of cloth.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take a known soap and fresh lard in one ounce. Mix those ingredients well, do this quickly so it is not rubbed too much; then spread this over a piece of cloth made thus like the leaf of a laurel, and place that over one or both areas; place the patient's buttocks partly immersed in a basin of oil, and the patient's head in your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place the said over the medicine and press it slightly so that the patient feels the bite of the medicine, for the bite is on him thus like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And then, to verify that the bite has occurred, let go of the medicine and apply it again in your lap; therefore, when the bite ceases, place the medicine back on and wash the area with water; then consider if the eyelid is already raised as if washed; if so, apply heat or incision, for then this is good; and if not, return to applying the medicine to the place where it has not yet been applied, without disturbing your operation and contracting the area.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place your hand over the area between which the knot of the adhustio should be eliminated, and cure that with an ointment or something else in which it may be healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And if necessary, you should keep careful vigil that no medicine falls into the eye, and if the eyelid becomes softened or some cause affects the skin around it in the wound, then repeatedly apply your medicine to that area where the eyelid has become softened, and do so in the same manner as at the beginning, and soon let it heal.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the method for washing the eye.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the eyes of humans vary in size and smallness, and therefore your incision should be made according to this.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the way of the right path should not be hidden from those who study in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cautery treatment of a fistula in the lacrimal gland of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula as we have said in the divisions of diseases and do not perform your cure accordingly, then when you cauterize it in this manner: command the patient to place his head on your thigh, and let some minister hold the head of the patient between your thighs in such a way that it is neither hurt nor agitated.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place the cautery on the vein in the flesh or over the blister on the sole of the foot.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then heat the cautery, the form of which is as follows:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be cylindrical, like the form of a cane or a bird's feather quill, from one end of which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, penetrate into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, let it be similar to a needle.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But nevertheless, that which is concave is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is opened, and draw from it clean and dry that which comes out.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not opened, then open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place the well-ignited cautery over it, and hold your hand a little above the cautery near the root of the nose, so that your hand does not touch or burn the patient, and then place the cautery on the nostrils and destroy that area.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so, if your cautery at the beginning enters the mouth, that is good; and if not, then reapply the cautery one or two times if necessary; and leave it in this manner for three days, and then place your hand over that spot to keep it warm and surround it with a drying ointment until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if ten days have passed and it is not healed, then place the sharp corrosive medicine on it until the bone is uncovered and scraped as you see fit in your chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And another way to cauterize a fistula which some first doctors will say: find the place of the fistula and do it there and then pause near that fissure like a thin line which is the form of it. Put in there the quantity of one ounce of melted lead; and keep your hand there with good retention, so that the bad humor does not enter through that where the melted lead does not penetrate to that place; and continue to pause over the hole of the bad humor as in album of honey or in water, for lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals that by marvelous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed as we have said of the cautery and the cure, well and good; but if not, then it is necessary to administer atra belladonna and reduce the fistula to the nose according to what will come in its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of the wound from the boil.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Small cracks often occur in the lips, especially in children's lips.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Then when you cure those cracks as we have said in the divisions and your cure is not effective, then heat the small surgical cautery according to this form that is taught:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	Let the cavity be as per the subtlety of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that heated cautery precisely in those cracks until it reaches the bottom of the cracks.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	Then cure that with cerote until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cautery treatment of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an abscess forms in the tonsil region or on the palate or in the tooth sockets, and then develops into a fistula that breaks open, becomes chronic, or is reformed as a fistula, and your cure is not effective, then heat the cautery according to the amount received in the fistula, place the heated cautery in the tract of the fistula, and keep your hand there until the hot iron reaches its bottom. Do this one or two times at the end. Then cure that with what we have said about the cure until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so, if the pus is removed and it is healed, that is good; otherwise, it is necessary to expose the area and fix the corrupted bone according to what will come in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	chapter .xx.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Cauterization of the teeth and mollification of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by humidity and the teeth are loose, first treat those with medicines and do not wait. Then place the patient's head in hot water, and soon after, heat the cautery to the form which will be given shortly. Try to pause the cautery over the tooth and insert it into that area vigorously, keeping the cautery there just a little while so that the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then lift your hand, and repeatedly apply the cautery several times as you see fit.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then the patient should close their mouth with salt water and keep it for an hour, then spit it out, as the loose tooth is sealed, the softened gum is tightened, and the corrupted humidity is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of the cautery for tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to inflammation or there is a swelling or you cannot achieve relief with medicine, then the cautery for that area can be performed in two ways: either with a calf's horn cautery or with a fire cautery.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	The calf's horn cautery is when you take the horn of a calf and blisters that part with iron, then take the blistered part and wrap it around the end of the probe, and immerse that in the blistered horn, placing it over the painful tooth forcefully to ensure it becomes inflamed.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeatedly do this several times to ensure the virtue of the fire permeates to the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, immerse a piece of wool or cloth in the horn mentioned above, and place that over the painful tooth, and hold the ignited iron over it until the iron permeates to the root of the tooth's cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	Moreover, however, the cautery with fire, you must attend to the shape of the wound or iron, and in its core there should be some coarse material so that the acuity of the fire does not reach the opening of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then shape the cautery in the form that will come, and place that one on the tooth and put your hand between it so that the cautery is well rubbed; and do this several times to prevent the pain from worsening or on that day or the other.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And ensure that due to the effect of that cautery, the patient opens their mouth properly and keep it this way for about an hour; and this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cautery it where you will stop according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the cannula:

De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cautery treatment for protrusions.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When the hernias are filled with phlegm and humors that are not obedient to digestion by medicines, and you have lightly digested those with medicine, then apply the cautery to the form of which this follows: having two open extremities so that smoke arises from one end through the other, and place that ignited cautery over that apostema for one minute, and another if needed until it reaches the root of the apostema.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit. Capitol .xxiii.	Capitol. xxiii.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	For the cautery treatment of hoarseness and constriction of the throat.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut. E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with what was preceded until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On the cauterization for lung disease and cough.

Capitol .xxv.	Capitol.xxv.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On the cautery for titillic, which is the head of the helper.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the helper is dislocated due to lubricating humidity and is not immobilized in the hour of its return, you should reduce the dislocation while it is about to naturally return, and then by a small movement, it will be dislocated as it tries to return, as we have testified. De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On the cautery for plague.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit. This is what you should do: take from the rough iron rods one long strip, which is about the thickness of a finger.

Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When there is venous congestion and humidity in the meatus, and for this reason, conception is prohibited, and the patient's menstrual flow is disrupted or delayed, and joint pain occurs due to this condition, then it is necessary to cauterize the area with three cauteries around the navel circuit, as we have said when discussing the bladder cautery; and apply a cautery over the lower part of the foot, or use two cauteries, and ensure that the cautery is applied properly.

De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	Of the cautery for the dislocation of the ankle.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When mucous humors infiltrate the region of the ankle, and are causes of displacement of its location, a sign of this is that the swelling extends over the other leg when compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the location of the dislocation is applied to the outer side of the foot.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Then cautery the ankle of the foot with a circular cautery, as you have marked around the region in the form of a circle as it is turned, so that the region falls in the middle of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And the shape of the cautery as described above is used in the cautery of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this cautery is not present, then use three large olive-shaped cauteries.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And the cautery should be applied according to the intensity of the pain throughout the limb; and then care for that which remains until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	Of the cautery treatment for the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain in the leg occurs and its cause is cold and humidity, the patient is treated with what we have said and you do not apply, and this is outdated. Instead, let the patient suffer from large humors by using stinking pills or artificial ones; then cauterize that area.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the method of cauterization in this case is according to two methods: either with burning medicines, or with a flame.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	Sir according to two scientific methods, of which one is to cauterize that area over the back of the leg with three triangular cauteries in this form; and do so with good depth.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And the spacing between each cauterization should be the width of one finger, whether the cauterization is small or large.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	More often, apply the cauterization in the middle of each location on the back of the leg, as there are four cauterizations.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	And if you wish, cautery the circle around which the form precedes in the cautery of the dislocation of the ankle, which should be a circle that burns the entire circumference.
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the way to cautery for the ankle when pain is localized to the ankle and not extended to the thigh.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if it is extended to the thigh, then cautery both areas on the thigh around the location where you will return the ankle that causes the pain; and with one cautery on the heel, a little should be applied to the cylindrical part.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if it is a surgical cautery, the depth of the cautery should be according to the intensity of the circumference.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if you return the ankle where the pain is extended near the base of the toes, then cautery that area with three or four or more points if needed.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the ankle returns pain to be felt in the thigh, then cautery that area with a surgical cautery.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	Guard yourself in all cautery that you do not end with the cautery to such an extent that you burn nerves or great artery, and because of this you are badly affected or contract something.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And I have already seen others who cauterized on the nail and ended with the cautery, and the bed was inflamed between where the tumor reached the foot, and the fire perforated and corrupted all the flesh.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And then follows a severe colic, and often death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two parts, cauterize each one according to this manner.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And the wise will say about the cautery for gout, of which this is the manner: make it resemble a circle of iron where the circumference is the width of one palm; and let its holes be according to the size of an finger bone or at most a little more.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And inside that circle, there is another third; and let the space between them be the quantity of the joint of the foot; and may those circles be opened in two parts; and let the length of those slots be one joint or two joints, and make at those iron margins decently fitted into the circles; this is the form of it:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Approximately it is ignited in the fire until it turns red and gives off sparks, and then it is placed on the part of the foot, the gout colletted over the sole.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And therefore cauterize it with three round cauteries in one go.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then let it be for three days; and apply a plaster with honey and let the wound remain open for many days; and cure it by anointing it until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Albucasis says: Oh, my son, we have little used this kind of cautery for the fear of looking at it, and because we have found few things regarding it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	More from the good cautery for him who suffers it, and find it in that place.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	More, a cautery with adhering medicines consists of making two circles having a perforated frame in which the smoke from the iron door is placed; let the length of the walls in their thickness be two nuts or quarters.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the space which is between each part of the quantity of the swelling of the digit; and be opened and below, and contain themselves among them according to this form:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	And then place your hand over the part of the ankle where the patient is lying, and hold your hand over the part of the ankle; and take some hot water and pour it between two circles, and let the quality of that be like fire little by little, and have that for the quantity of one hour, and suffer the patient the biting and sticking of it — since that empty space bites like fire — until the biting ceases.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	And then lift your hand with the instrument and wipe away the hot water from all around the ankle with cold water.
