And then let it be for three days and place your hand over that border until the blackness of the stuck state fades, and let this be for some days, and the redness will go away; this is derier in juvenescence.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with ointment until it is healed.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain is extended to the thigh or the leg, make an incision in it that contains water according to how it is done in the water.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the way of water caudation, and I have already written that in the treatise on the rectification of medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Recipe for alkali and for a fire not extinct from both parts one, trim the ashes in a new cauldron of which the part left is pierced by a small hole, according to the quantity that enters it.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And place the bottom of another cauldron over the heated one, and pour water gently over the live alkali and ashes so that they are covered by an inch, and then take those up with your hand for good compression, and let the water droplets from the sharp water fall into the part left in the heated cauldron.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc. And Gualia recounts an operation and cure of an ancient man suffering from water pain and sciatic vein pain. The doctor magnified the good deed and said no other treatment was necessary, for he was cured in one session as recommended, for his condition improved greatly with baths and exercises as instructed.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat. E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And it should be left in place for three hours or until the patient feels relief from the application.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	And then place it in bath water, and when the patient's body is warmed, insert it into the soil, for the pain ceases and the patient is cured.

May I also state that when making a cut in the sinew vein, cauterizing it will make it heal better; and the way to use the cautery is: take wool and soak it in old oil, and place it between the layers of the foot and between the bones.

Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this way of using the cautery is called the calf cautery.

De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	Of cautery for ruptures.

E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And ensure that you nourish him according to the length of time for his cure, so that the intestine does not come out. You must make great efforts to heal.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And when it is time to lift him after 10 days, properly apply a plaster, and keep it for another 10 days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And he should rest and replenish his food and drink, and use strong voices. For when he follows this regimen for complete recovery, he will surely be healed.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And I will describe the cure for ruptures in other parts of the abdomen. At the beginning, and if they do not tear further, then cauterize the rupture with a round cautery according to its size; this is what is drawn from the cord in the same way as the tender part of it. Then care for it as we have said, and it is not sutured.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And some have said that a rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this form, rather than with forceps.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And place a line there for the width in the slashes above the rupture, and another line on top; then place your hand with a triangular cautery, but the first cautery is lighter and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	Capitol XLVI.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	Of the cauterization of the fistula.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When pain in certain limbs persists due to inflammation or percussion and does not respond to medical treatment over a long period, then you should cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And the size and nature of the cautery should be according to the magnitude and smallness of the fistula, its virtue and development, and the location and pain associated with it.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Then if the fistula is cured by the first cautery, that is good; but if not, then repeat the cautery on it; for customarily, those pains are punctured in a nearby limb to achieve the cautery where the disease lies until the fistula is healed.
Capitol .xlvii.	Capitol forty-seven.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	Of the cautery treatment for leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Lepers are sometimes treated with a large cautery, especially when the species of leprosy is caused by the putrefaction of flame and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And so, if you want to cauterize that area, consider whether the leprosy is common and of that kind cured as we have said in the division and neither this nor that. Then fear that the corruption may encompass all of his body and all of his composition; therefore, cauterize that area on the head with five cauteries: one in the middle of the head, leave the second space from it, place the forehead at the end of the hairline; two on the horns; and one behind, on the neck or shoulder.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finish your hand with the cautery a little inside where it makes a small impression in the mouth, so that the scabs are displaced, thereby alleviating the expiration of gross vapors; cauterize on the tongue according to necessity.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if leprosy is already spread over the patient and appears manifestly, then you cauterize there and those cauterizations which we said in the head; on the extremity of the nose, and on two cauterizations on the two mammary glands, and on two cauterizations on two vertebrae of the neck, and on six cauterizations on the vertebrae of the back, and a large one near the coccyx, and one on the spine, and on two on the hips, and one on each hip, and on two on the knees, and one on each knee, and on two on the elbows, and two on the muscles, and two on his foot bones; cauterize there over all the joints of the fingers of the hands and of the feet, and on each heel of his feet, and on the knuckles of his toes.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And guard the nerves which are over the heel that you do not burn those.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And sometimes cauterization is done with one cauterization on the bone of the pelvis and another on the entrance of the stomach, and another on the liver.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And know that the more tightly you adjust the cautery, the more beneficial and effective it is; and know that the patient does not feel pain in the cautery as they do elsewhere, since their body is already numbed.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And know that the cautery should be large or small according to the limbs and joints, as directed by the species of the instruments.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the cautery with a mixture of roasted flour and honey, as well as other treatments until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Capitol. liv.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	On the cautery for stupefaction.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When some limb is numbed or asleep and is treated with medicines, oils, and plasters, and does not heal, then you cautery that numb limb with cauteries according to the size of the limb or its smallness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let your cautery penetrate the thickness of the skin a little.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that which is ointed until it is healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And sometimes parts of the body, such as the head and feet, and the spinal columns on both sides are cauterized, and the vision of the nerves which run through that member is impaired, and the stupor is aggravated.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	But do not presume on this, but only those who are skilled in the anatomy of the members and the distribution of the nerves throughout the moving body.
Capitol .xlix.	Capitol XLIX.
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	Of the cauterization of ulcers that become morphew.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When ulcers are old and you do not apply any of the medicines' ointments to them, then cauterize over that with a cautery, proceeding according to the quantity of the paste of the cochenil. Let the white and the color of it be remedied, and its color be changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that which is anoint with flour of ergot and lentils in roasted oil and leaves of rosemary, or pigeon droppings or turkey droppings, each having one part, all being mixed together. Then place a cloth over the area until it is healed.
Capitol .l.	Capitol I.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	Of cautery for the knee.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer begins and you want to stop it, then cauterize it with a circular cautery in the circumference of the area as it is revolved.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And the wise will say that it should be cauterized with the last cautery in the middle spot; but to me, this is not visible, for I fear it is ulcerated, and I have seen this a few times.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	And it is more proper to cauterize in the circumference of the area with a circle as we have said, or with several cauteries.
Capitol .li.	Capitol II.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	Of cautery for ulcers.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When some ulcers are delayed in maturation, this is either due to excess fluid making them so, or due to the patient's condition, who is old and decrepit, or has little strength, or due to time, and you want to hasten their maturation; then cauterize in the circumference of the ulcer with several small puncturing cauteries; and leave those that will mature on their own.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	If you want to make a puncture with the cautery, then ignite the cautery of which this is the form: then place it in the middle of the affected area where the needle will penetrate.
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you place the cautery in that location, let it be, so that the arm will be relieved; and then cure that which will be healed.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter II.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On the cautery for corrosion.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corrosion is a gradual corruption in the member, which corrodes it as fire consumes dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if you find the corrosion in a location where a fire-cautery is to be applied, then ignite the cautery with a few large and hot coals, according to what is appropriate for that particular location affected by corrosion.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then cauterize that completely as you remove all the corrosion and do not leave any cause of it.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	And allow that for three days, and place a hot cautery on the areas previously cauterized only after all the sores have been completely eradicated and all corruption removed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And treat that with ointment generating flesh.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if after three days the flesh grows healthy in the area where there is no corruption, that is good. But if not, then reapply the cautery to the areas that are rotten in the corrupted spots.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And after treating with some medicines several times using sharp medicine, which is half the treatment of a cautery.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	But however, a cautery with fire is more beneficial for slight wounds.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already explained the treatment with sharp medicine in the division, so use that when you need it.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter III.lix.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On the cautery of wounds and similar conditions.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Small stones placed in the painful parts of the foot which are called clavus, and it is a large, penetrating injury that affects the foot; and cautery there is done in two ways, one with fire and one with water-caused cautery.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	The cautery with fire is to heat the concave cautery resembling a backward hook, which is made of iron according to the quantity that can contain the stone from all parts, and it should have fine edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	Then place that heated cautery over the stone, and quickly move your hand with the cautery in a circle around the stone until the cautery reaches the depth of the stone.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	Let it be there for three days until it begins to blister.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	Then apply a poultice to it with wild thyme boiled in salt water, and let the poultice remain on it for one night, so that the stone is removed from its place.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with a cream of generative flesh until it heals.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	If they are not converted, and motas (small blisters or lesions) occur on the surface of the body, especially in the hands and feet, then when you administer cautery with water, take a quannaula of elm or iron or a cinder stick, place it over the nail; then put some water in the quannaula, withdraw your hand, and move that with compression of your hand from all sides, pressing the margin of the quannaula on the root of the nail, and you will find the water flowing through the hole of the nail; wait for the patient a little while after the bite of the flowing water for an hour, then remove that, as the nail will have its roots eroded.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And do the same to those and then the other, until you come over all of which they have in their body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And then cure those pustules where the nail roots have been eradicated by applying ointments on which the flesh will regenerate.
Capitol .liiii.	Capitol. liiii.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	Of the cautery for trembling.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When an ache or tremor occurs due to friction in the nerves or from fever of a similar cause, then you should cautery it with four or five cauteries on the spine, placing one cautery between each vertebra; and one on the foot, and one over his stomach, using an olive cautery.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the tremor in him subsides, and recovery from the illness follows.
Capitol .lv.	Capitolium.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	Of the cautery for ailments affecting the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When in the body abscesses have formed and pustules have developed, which are made of thick corrupted materials; then at the beginning as they appear, the fistula should be cauteryed with a fine cautery using a branch of myrtle, the end of which is extended over the fire; or with an herb from erestologia longua; or with a flat cautery.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And sometimes a cautery is applied additionally at the beginning of its expulsion according to this manner; and they do not believe it, making those who are diseased healthy.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	More over I must say that this should be done near the evacuation by phlebotomy.
Capitol lvi.	Capitol lvi.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	Of the cautery treatment for flux from an injury due to arterial incision.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Often when flux from an artery is incised, the wound which needs to be lanced, or from the incision of an abscess or cautery on the member, it appears, and is difficult to heal.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Then when such a case occurs, you hold your hand over the orifice of the artery, and place it there firmly until the flow of blood stops, then remove your hand, and let it not leak.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	Then place the olive cautery in the fire for a few large and small puffs, by number many times, and blow on them until they are well heated.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And then take one small or large according to the place and the wound in which the artery is broken, over that vein pressing strongly as you have previously tied, and hold the cautery close so that it is narrowed and restricted that blood.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the hole of the artery when you tie it and narrow the cautery, then take another cautery prepared among the cauteries which are in the fire, and therefore do not cease to do this one after another so that the blood is restricted.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And make sure you do not burn the nerves here, and that no other evil comes upon the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when blood flows from the artery, it is not possible to restrict the blood flow using a cautery in this manner, especially when the artery is large, unless one of four methods is used: either with a cautery as we have said, or with extraction when it is not extracted, which when it is extracted, its ends are burned and the blood flow is restricted, or it is tied with filth or with resin by strong tension, or it is paused over medicines from which the virtue is to restrict the blood; and they should be tightly bound with a pulvinar in a proper constriction.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But he who administers proper restraint to it with flax and with tension of cloths or by the position due to burning causes and similar ones, does not relieve it so well.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if he needs to do so for someone and neither the doctor is present nor medicine, then open it carefully with his finger over the orifices of that vein as we have said, and understand the great constriction within which the sore has been left from the upper part of the wound, and on the archery, let the finger not be removed; and above the archery, sprinkle water mixed with a strong flegmative while the sore is congealed and swollen; and more apply heat in case cauterization or medical necessity.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Start the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and perforation and fistulas and of phlebotomy and of wounds and their similarities.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucazis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter all illness in which cauterization with fire is convenient and phlebotomy, and the occasions and causes of it, and the instruments necessary for those of the forms of cauterizations; and I have ordered the chapters of the subiranetat of the cap between the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And you shall proceed in this chapter in that manner, so that the one who desires this may be relieved of what he has requested.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before you begin this, hear, sons, that in this chapter what is treated pertains to the fear of what is in the first chapter on cautery.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And hear, that you be in great caution, for in the operation which is in this chapter, motes of catz evacuation are used, which if it is a case where life is at stake, you should perform the aspersio of the vein or incision on the apostema or accretion, or excision or purgation of the wound or extraction of the arrow or incision of the abscess, and operations similar to these.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And of all these, there is always fear and trembling, and in the most serious cases, death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that this applies to you in cases of fainting, for in some instances, your methods may be mistaken for the methods of those who are unskilled.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And some of them will go to their illness and die, this due to the intensity of what they find from their illness, and for the length of the illness, and in the illness is fear which means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And of those, the ones who give you their ache and tell, you expecting that their health will improve, and their illness is harmful.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore you must consent to only those who come to you, of which this is the manner; and your caution should be greater than covetousness and your greed; and do not presume on any cause but rather certain science which verifies what you must do, and to which a successful outcome brings praise.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the cure of all your patients based on their prognosis and indication of where health is converted; for in that you have assistance in gaining fame and memory, praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	O, children, God imparts His understanding to you and does not withhold direction and protection, for this is in His hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have also arranged this chapter distinguishing it into chapters as previously described in the chapter on cautery, concerning the cure from head to foot, so that you may be aided by what you ask for and of which you have need.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the cure of water that is contained in the head of the child.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this illness often appears in children during childbirth and when the mother's strength strengthens the child's head.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes appears for hidden causes that are unknown.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have only seen this illness in children; and in all those whom I have seen, it has led to death, so I have been left with the work of treating them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen that a child's head was filled with water, and his head remained always swollen until it could no longer bear its own weight due to the size of his head, and more because the humidity increased inside leading to death.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity is added either between the tendon and the bone, or it is caused by placing the bone on the cushion.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	And if the operation in that case where the humidity is between the tendon and the bone and the abscess is small, you should make a slit in the middle of the lesion in a width, such that the length of the slit allows the humidity to drain, and this is the form of the incision:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And if the humidity is much increased and the abscess is larger, then here you should make two slits in this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is on the bone, the sign of this is that you will see the edges of the lesion open completely, and the water oozes out when you press it with your hand on the inner parts; this is not what you want to hide.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And if the humidity is between the tendon and the bone, you should make three slits in the middle of the lesion in this manner:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And quickly extract all the humidity; then strengthen the slits with bandages and feathers; on the fifth day, pour oil over them; remove the dressing and cure the wound with lint and ointments, strengthening the tendon with equal parts; let the patient eat dry food of little humidity until the limb is comfortable and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another method of incision, which consideras regarding the size of the abscess and the collection of water; for in some instances it may be more in the occiput, or in the anterior part, or on the right side, or on the left; and therefore attend to the incision where the abscess and the filling with water appear, and do so according to what is most convenient for you.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you do not incise the artery and attempt to let blood from the patient by that flow of blood for the evacuation of moisture.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter II.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of the incision of the arteries which are near the ears, called hemorrhages.
Capitol segon.	Chapter II.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When we encounter a catarrh or wound in the ears or foot, this is an ancient practice, and you should not rely on the treatment of medicines for it; rather, the proper treatment involves incising these two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore when you want to incise those that the malady root has its head, then rub the place with rough cloth so that the arteries appear, and strengthen the neck of the malady with some cloth; and consider where lies the vein; and the places over which lie the auricles pressing, and they are hidden in almost all men.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then press over the artery with your finger, and incise each one with a sharp knife along the path of the vein, and do this for the width of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you want, insert the knife leaving the artery and cut it at the points above its divisions.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And let the length of the incision be two fingers wide, for when a vein is cut, the bleeding occurs at the pulsating exit, which bursts forth with frequent spurts.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear at the incision, then measure from the auricle the quantity of space of three fingers, and press there with your finger, and make the incision into the flesh.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And that which flows from the wound is a quantity of blood one uncia, and much or little it flows, and all this is according to the quantity which appears from the virtue of the malady and the distension of the artery of the leg.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then consider the wound, and therefore if there remains on the bone any cause of suppuration, then incise it so that no abscess forms.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then strengthen the wound with down feathers and cloth lint, and then cure that by applying ointments until it heals.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	On the extraction of arteries which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When an old or acute migraine occurs due to damp conditions and the quality of the air in the temples, or if it is a strong old pain similar to those, and is treated according to the methods of medical cure, and this does not relieve you, then we have resorted to the extraction of arteries in the temples, or cauterization of those as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the manner of the operation and extraction is that you raise the skins which are on the temples; and understand the apparent artery in the temple where it is shown to you by your own pulse, and is hidden in only a few men through the violence of cold.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden to you, then lift the neck of the patient with some cloth; and then rub the area with a rough cloth or evaporate the place with water until the artery becomes clearly visible.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then you take the spatum of which this is the form:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then you burn the artery with that as facilitated until you reach the artery; and then get onto it with oil and extract that to the upper parts while you withdraw that from the codena and discover that of the tunics which you leave there, from all parts.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	More if the artery is thin, then wrap it at the extremity of the oncia, and then incise a part according to the quantity for which the extremities of the oncia are lengthened and contracted, and no flux of sand will be found, for if not incised, the sand will not rise from there.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then evacuate from the vein one. within three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is large, then you must divide it into two places with a firm double fold of each or with long cords, and do not touch it until putrefaction occurs before the consolidation of the wound and ensure the flow of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then cut the superfluity which is between two threads; and do this at that time or shortly thereafter.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you wish, cauterize it with a cautery on the bone and with a surgical knife at the points where the threads are cut; and this will take the place of that operation.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is better to do so unless the patient has fever or is of cold nature; for a cautery is of those causes that help in expelling humidities, and therefore it is better in convalescence.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And you must then make the extraction of the arteries that you have placed in a proper location, and they should be packed over with properly made dry powders, and be covered with medicinal plasters until it is healed.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while working another time you encounter a flow of blood from the artery, then you should constrict that blood, with a cautery or by filling the place with cotton, and firmly hold your hand to restrict the blood.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if for any of those reasons it is not at your present, then hold your hand over the area until the bleeding stops, and apply the place with water of strong refrigeration until the heat calms down, and strengthen as necessary.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And what is lighter in the extraction of an artery is that you cauterize the vein with this cautery having two knives, after you have marked the two places with hot probes, and hold burning coals over them until they reach the bone and cut the vein into two parts, so that what is between the extremities of it can be extended, which are not consolidated by this entire cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And let the heat of the two knives be sufficient.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	But if the pain is acute as if cut by two knives, near each cautery, and you do not incise the flesh with speed.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	So when there is some swelling, keep the heat of the fire on those areas and the flesh is incised slightly.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this method is better in all works and more slight.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And let the space which is between two knives be the quantity of the swelling of the digit.
Capitol quart.	Capitol quart.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	Of the cure for feet with acute and sour tears.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When there are sour tears, and the body is from the veins which are on the sole of the foot, and you find no cause for the cure in medicine, and sometimes the face of the patient turns red and feels a crawling sensation on his forehead as if it were being walked on by ants, and the feet become weak and softened so that their skins are well known, and the eyelids are scalded by the acuteness of the tears, they should use the old method in the cure of those for this operation, and number that cure among the passing things.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you command the patient to stretch the skin that is on his forehead, and then incise in the forehead three equal distances according to the length of the forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the incision is two fingers: the first incision should be equally distant to the length of the nose in the middle of the forehead, and the second according to the length of a little movement of the tears which are in the lacrimal gland, and the third on another part.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And beware of the beginning of the arteries which are in two branches, and keep your hand away from the continuation of both jawbones.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space of each incision the quantity of three fingers, adjusted.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a piece of sponge equipped or dry cloths at hand, place them over which to dry the wound.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And then insert the tip of two sharp instruments, the form of which is the incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	that is from the place between the temples into the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Exsorve all the fluid that is between two incisions along the crest which is above the bone, and then do the same for the middle incision into the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	Then scrape this exudate and insert it into the first incision another time with another instrument which is called a scalpel, sharp on one side and blunt on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	Then place the blade of the scalpel against the adjacent flesh, open the ligament, and the blade inside the bone. Insert it there until it reaches the middle fissure, and cut all the vessels that descend from the head to the feet.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	More importantly, continue the incision to where the ligament appears, and then do the same in the middle fissure between the other fissure.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And after the bleeding has equalized, express the areas of the ankles with a concave tool.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then place your hand over any gouty crack in the old skin, and place it above those powders mixed in wine and oil and vinegar, ensuring that no abscess forms.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	On the seventh day remove the bandage and administer a strong infusion of walnut or hazel water, and then cure what is ointed with basilicum oil and others so that the wounds may heal.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	For the cure of tears due to catarrh and those drooping from the inner parts of the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When there is a severe and continuous catarrh, and the tears from the eyes are small and diminished, and their look shows debility, and the eyelids are ulcerated and the skin around them is affected, and in the forehead there is acute pain along with an extreme swelling, then you can judge that the humors and catarrh do not come from the internal vessels originating within.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure in such cases is this: you should command the patient to rub his forehead, and then incise a small crack right through the center of the forehead. Start from the left temple between the two temples; the incision should be into the bone, extending your hand along the ridges of the temples, which are prominent, and should involve thorough excision of the bone.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry all the blood on the sponge or dry cloth and then place it between the two lips of the fissure with a piece of old cloth or a dry cloth.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	Strengthen it further with powders mixed in wine and oil so that no abscess forms.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you uncover this and see that the abscess has diminished, then wash the bone where it begins to have new flesh grow, and then cure it with an exsiccative regimen which causes the flesh to wither, as if you take two parts of wheat flour and four parts of resin and mix them, and from them make a plaster and administer it in these wounds of the flesh's nativity.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the cure for what catches in the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	All cause that catches in the ears is of four species: either it is mineral stone or a cause similar to stone, such as iron or flint, or it is from plant matter such as dust or bean pods, or it is a fluid cause such as water or wine and substances similar to them, or some beast.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And when purgation occurs in the ear or another cause similar to those causes that do not fit nor swell in the ear, and you place the ear in the sun, and if you touch the foot, then it distills in some cause of olive oil or sesame, then return the extraction of it, and make him sneeze with a condiment, and plug his nostrils to prevent sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And place some pieces of cloth or wool in the circuit of the ear, and extend the ear to the parts above, where motas (small particles) are likely caused by these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not caused by motas, then perform the extraction of it with the instrument called gesti epicicarios subtil, of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is caused by motas, that is good; otherwise, then perform the extraction of it with a fine onci of little duplication.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And if it is not caused by motas, then make a cannula of wire and insert the end of the cannula into the meatus of the ear and close around the cannula with wax and olive oil made milder so that it does not open except the cannula.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract the bowels with strong traction, for too many views as we have recounted.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not extracted in this manner, then take some alummed salt or vinegar apparatus on which the organs are placed a quantity of paws, place that at the extremity of the ray, and then wrap about that corner decently.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the channel of the ear with facility, and then dry the ear of its moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And so if it is not extracted by all the causes which we have recounted, then you cut to excise that which tends to become an abscess or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the manner of excising it is that at the beginning you mark the patient's leg from the thigh to the knee according to the virtue of the vein, and then make a cut between your fingers and convert the ear to its upper parts, and make a small fissure in the cartilage of the ear and insert the grey matter there.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And let the crack be of lunar shape through which it reaches the heel, and if the heel is infected, obstruct it if possible with appropriate instruments; then, over that crack at that time apply velocity, and cure it within the time it becomes healed.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause settles in the ear, it is one of those oils that plug and are inflamed, then administer the cure and extraction of it; but if it does not yield to your application, then take fine thin spatula according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	And administer the extraction of that oil which is embedded in the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do this when you think that it is already moistened by the vapor of the ear, and place it on fine wicks, and properly extract it in those areas or with a subtle gesture, or by incision as we have said, for this makes the extraction easier.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water which has entered into the ear canal that the patient uses for sneezing at the onset of illness, and fills their ear with some old oil or vinegar, place it on that ear where is the water, and if by this is forced out, well; otherwise, then take small pebbles of iron or lead according to the length of the finger, heat those in the fire a little, and have the patient insert one of those into the tube of their ear and jump over a piece of that part and strike it with another stone on the stone which is inside the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Do not stop applying leeches until all the water has been drawn out.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc i, e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And when the water has been sufficiently drawn out, take either paper or wax, and put one end in the ear and extend the other end in fire until the wax is burned.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And place another wax and do this as many times as necessary until all the water has been drawn out, and remove that with a cannula as previously described.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	More in the extraction of matter entering that ear, if it is a small mass, proceed similarly and treat it as we have said in the division. But if it is a large mass that appears prominently within, then perform the extraction with speed and precision, and the cause of it is less significant compared to all other causes that appear in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	More in the extraction of worms generated in the ear, when you treat it as we have said in the division and in the tractatus de distillacions, and if your treatment does not seem to be effective, then look into the ear with the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if here appears any cause of worms, then extract that with a gesture or fine forceps, but if no such cause appears, then take a cannula and open it wide, for this is its form:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	I insert the subtle extremity into the ear according to the quantity that the patient can bear; and then I suck it out by strong suction, performing this many times until all the worms are extracted.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if it does not obey to your assistance, then you open and close the circuit of the cannula with wax as we have said; then administer distillations which have already been proven effective in the treatment of worms, and you will find this in the treatise on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let your effusion be with that which you pour medicinal oils into the ear with this instrument, for this is its form:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make that of silver or gold, straight, with a small hole in it, and a flat surface on top.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And so it should be done to ensure that it is in the cavity of the catheter here where it will be necessary.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take the wick and wrap it properly around its end, then place oil in the cavity of the ear, or the juice of some herb, or any medicine you desire into the catheter — which is in the ear —, and then insert the wick carefully above and squeeze your hand on it with a gentle compression until the oil is expelled into the cavity of the ear and the disease feels the oil inside.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what is infused into the ear should already be heated over a small fire.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And make sure that the medicine you will distill into the ear is not too hot, for ear medicines cannot tolerate that.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the Treatment of Ear Abscesses.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Sometimes children contract abscesses in the flesh of their ears from their mothers' non-perforated navels, and this occurs in some adults as well, with an abscess forming in the ear meat due to a wound or without any apparent cause; sometimes this abscess forms in the preauricular area which does not show external signs, and at other times it forms in the outward parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which occurs in the prepuce of him, which does not involve the visible part, is in the major disposition for difficult healing.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that where you can see the part, make sure that you place the patient in the sun and look at it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if you see an obvious swelling, open the small incision under which this swelling is located:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the extremity in which the width is small, where one part is acute and the other is not; and the swelling is of two lion's teeth so that it does not irritate the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And if the obstruction is due to hidden flesh in the ear or in the meat of the ear, then make small incisions and cut deeply enough to remove all the flesh.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the obstruction is in the prepuce of the ear, then take a thin lion's tail and heat that wire slightly in fire, and place it in the flesh of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And therefore, if you sense an abundance of what the patient has in sufficiency due to the weight of excretion, relieve the oppression by facilitating evacuation; and make sure not to injure the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then place the cloth in the ear according to the amount of the swelling which you have wrapped in Egyptian ointment; and do this for several days until you are sure of the healing of the wound; or that you infuse it in water and pulverize it over the dry trissa and use it; and if you see the ear already perforated, then clean it thoroughly and change the liquid with another one which you wrap in a cloth made of rubbed oil, until the abscess is reduced; and cure it as it heals.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if a blood flow occurs, then immerse the sponge or cloth in cold water, wring it out, and place it on the ear, and use the other treatment which constricts the flow of blood, which is described in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Of the care of an eyelid that has become inflamed.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Eyelids that occasionally become moist, and some become dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Then ensure that you have those hand towels or sponges, and wipe away the foam from their mouths, and place your hands over these areas.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if there is pain with a flow of hot blood, then cauterize those areas with a thin cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cautery treatment is near the incisions, and the wounds return when there remains any cause of their bleeding; and when they are cauterized with fire, those wounds are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Care for inflammation of the eyelids caused by hot blood.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Spots appear in the eyelids caused by some cause which is similar to inflammation in its strength and hardness, and for this reason it is called inflammation.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And this is an addition of thick moisture in the eyelid above and below.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	And the operation is that you consider whether the enlargement is present in it where it appears from the eyelid and is felt throughout; and the cause of it is slight.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	And make a fissure there for the width, and then probe it thoroughly with a probe to facilitate drainage, and lift that and cut it.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you do not have an instrument to start it, so that you must penetrate the eyelid with a small incision gradually, then do not notice any cause for this.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is large, then you adjust it with sutures; and care for it until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, you will not suffer ill from it because the ointment restores and heals it.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the enlargement is decreasing within the parts of the eyelid, you should reduce the inner surface, then probe the eyelid and lift the enlargement with a probe, another that you choose for incision, and press it thoroughly. If the eyelid by incision is stretched, then do not notice any cause for this.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And at the beginning, wash the wound with salt water; and dress the area with a bandage until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Capitol.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	For the treatment of excoriation above the eyelid.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Excoriation is caused by grays that are generated in the tunics of the upper eyelid, and especially in children, it aggravates the ulcers in them and affects their catarrh, potentially leading to death; they cannot look at the clarity of the sun due to this, which causes tears to flow into those areas.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.
