And the cloth should be of such quantity as to communicate with the entire sinus; then cut with the scissors along the right side of the sinus opening a slightly wider slit than the sinus opening; next, extend over another piece of linen the lion's ointment according to the size of the slit, and place it above that in a position away from the sinus opening so that the abscess is drained and does not interfere with the cloth for several days only once.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	May he who is over the opening of the sinus, whom you warm at all times so that it does not come out what is inserted in it with the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you may know if what flows from the arm is much or little, or is digestible, or is non-digestible.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And so you consider the place of that sinus, if in it the patient feels pain or not, and if there is an abscess.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And as your medication is prolonged in this manner, and you see the matter that is discharged over the opening of the sinus already adheres, or approaches adherence, then when you remove the dressing, immediately change the cloth and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	May it be that from the sinus there is a subtle virus present, then do not waste time waiting for its adherence, for the healing of it approaches, for some people take longer for flesh generation in their wounds, and in those, the opposite occurs.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if for several days the sinew is situated near the limb in an indigest position, then you shall perceive that the sinew does not adhere; and if adherence of the sinew is delayed and the cause is prolonged, then you adjust in drying of the medicines, and if the medicines are moist in their substance and in their virtue, they are dried thus as ointment liniment when there is an excess of addition of fat.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the one that is more recently injured, you should take ointment liniment and dissolve it in sweet oil, and apply an old piece of cloth in its substance, and compress it with something soft, and use this.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And make it seem in that action when there is no limb, liniment fat, honey when mixed in that it is thickened, and use this; or what you take myrrh and aloes and incense, and mix all and powderize over the honey which is on the fire, and then line it with something soft, and strengthen it over the sinew; and line it with the honey which you have mixed in that it is thickened, and powderize over cloth and strengthen it.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And sometimes administration is made to him of long pepper and reasons of celestial mallow (and the celestial mallow) and powder of err and centaury, and use those simples or adjusted, squeeze them and sift over the honey which I have recommended; and use it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinus is prolonged and is not healed by this treatment, then you should know that the corruption is in the root of it, and investigate in the bones or in the other hard members or ligaments; then you cure it by fistula treatment, as was said above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	For the treatment of tumors, fingernail attrition, and incision of the digit with sectioning.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Panarici is an apostema which leaves the nail of the finger of the hand or foot loose, and is hard in other fingers, and as it is prolonged, its healing is less valued; or it is a chronic apostema from a deep-seated one, or it is corrupted, and a branch enters where you corrode the root of the nail, and thoroughly corrupts that part, and spreads its corruption to the bone within which it gives off an odor; and the extremity of the finger is amputated, and the color of the wound becomes yellowish.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And when you have done that as we said in the division and do not apply your cure, then proceed to insert all the superfluity that is discharged from the joint and nearby, and place a cautery on that area, for a cautery movement is beneficial in this.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If the bone is so and the joint is healthy, and the swellings of the joint have already compressed the flesh to the inner parts, and begin to pierce and lead that, then proceed to pause a thin ray under the angle of the joint that pierces the flesh, and push that up and cut that flesh with ease, and place over what remains of the flesh from the medicines burning corrosively until it be thoroughly resolved; and place a salve over that until it is healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	If the corruption has already entered the bone, then proceed to cut out the bone there and remove it, for no time will heal what is corrupted in the bone.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you see the corrosion and the corruption going into the same area, then proceed to cut there in one of the joints according to where the memory of its location is preserved, and place a salve over it until it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if at the joint there is percussion or friction, and the pain is very severe, then you should start by venesection at the site of pain, and immediately dry the joint with an incision using sharp transverse sections of the skin, and be careful that the section does not reach the flesh left by the joint, for you will thereby cause the patient severe pain, which will be due to the natural condition of excessive flesh in excess in that place; and cure that area with what alleviates pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	But this is adjusted, which is natural in many people, the flesh is very strong and heavy, or the bones are very strong and heavy, or the joint is very strong and heavy.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And in some it is located at the site of the joint, or the natural condition is strong and heavy in certain nodules of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But that which is natural in certain nodules of the fingers is not painful, and this which is located at the joints is more painful.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And for those that are natural fleshly, the incision is light, and you should cut there with a sharp lancet.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	More difficult for those born near the joint, the cure is; therefore, beware of its removal.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	More difficult for those born near the kneecap, ensure that you incise the beginning of the flesh around in a round cut into the bone, and nearby will be one of those convenient grooves for this, and cure what is inside until it is healed.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	More difficult the consolidation which occurs to the fingers among their joints due to observed swellings or by nature of the man who is born with it, or by consolidation of plague or by burning, then ensure that you heal this consolidation until the fingers return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And place your hand between the cloths where you have infused oil, so that they do not consolidate lightly, and separate between them, or place a thin sheet of lead between them until they are consolidated as needed.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly, if consolidation occurs in some fingers at the palm, then dry that consolidation as prepared and shape it to match the figure of the limb.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of veins, they are varicose.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Veins are varicose, and they are thickened veins filled with melancholic superfluities that move in the parts of the body, and their greatest occurrence is in the groins, especially in the groins of those who travel, work, and carry things.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Then administer a purge of the body with black bile several times until the expulsion is strong, and subsequently bleed the patient from the internal jugular vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	More importantly, the treatment for them can be done in two ways: one way is to incise and extract that black blood, and the other way is to elevate the vein and remove it entirely.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The procedure is as follows: apply a compress to the groin area with warm water until the thick blood has resolved and become watery. Then strengthen the patient's thigh by binding it above the knee on the inner side using a bandage, leaving the lower part exposed. Next, compress the vein in one, two, or three places with a broad compress. Using your hand, elevate the black blood from below the groin upwards into the abdomen and then downward. Do this until you have removed the quantity of blood you desire, which is sufficient to alleviate the condition's influence.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then tie her up, and command her to abstain from foods generating black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And continue the cure through phlebotomy when the veins are filled and this is noted by the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	Raise the limb in this manner: you lift the thigh of the patient, if there are hair roots on it, then immerse it in warm water and wrap the thigh with wet cloth until it becomes red and the veins swell; or exercise it forcefully if warm water is not available, until the limb is heated.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then dry the skin along the vein by sectioning it lengthwise or at the rear of the limb you may cut it, or lower down at the base.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then cut the skin with scissors and scrape out the vein from all parts until you feel it, and you should notice its appearance as that knot declining to black.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And then, after removing the skin, you will see that white thing which is like a cord.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then place that part of the sheet elevated and folded from the knee, and suspend it on an iron hook or lion's claw.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then dry another section near that section for three digits, and then scrape the knee from above the vein as it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then elevate that and incise the rear section of the tendon, and then extract that and elevate it where it enters through the second section, and then extract it from the section that is above that.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do this where you extract that from the section that is further above or higher than all other sections, once everything is inserted; then incise that.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you do not obey to extract and elevate, then insert a strong doubled needle with a thread and tie that, and then extract it. Or insert that part of the sheet and move your hand in all directions where it is folded.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And make sure it is not incised; for if it is broken, it will be difficult to elevate that part and has come over the wound through that damage.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when all of that is done, then place over the site of the wound wool soaked in wine and olive oil, both roasted and unroasted, and care for it until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the wound is contracted having curvature in which there is an encircling at the parts, and does not follow straightness as we have said, then cut over it entirely at all parts of its curvature and at the places of its encircling, and place it under supports so that you lift it entirely.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And guard yourself in your section so that you do not cut the vein and do not damage it, for it will be difficult to lift it; use your prudence in this.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Form of the cut where the wound is dry:
Forma de unci orp:	Form of the support orr:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not as with other supports nor of acute extremity because it does not damage the vein; and it is of great flexibility like a lion, for if it were subtle, it would cut the vein due to its subtlety; having it in its superfluous thickness as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	From the extraction of the leg vein.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in lands with tails like those described by Avicenna in the lands of Arabia and in the dry lands of India, which have little strength and in which neither grass nor trees grow.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And the vein is generated in other parts of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And its generation is from putrefaction that leaves the chain thus like snakes and worms and lice and other worms breeding between the chain and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And the sign of the susceptibility to the advent of this is when you encounter in the leg inflammation; nearby the area becomes blisters; nearby the vein starts to swell at the place of that blistering, as if it were a plant sprouting.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And then when the extremity appears, immediately cover that area with a piece of lead weighing as much as one drachm, or two drachms, and press it there, letting the lead hang from the leg.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as often as any cause affects the parts outside, wrap this in lead and anoint that.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if the wound is prolonged, then you incise a part of it and cover the remainder; and do not incise that which is inside while it is outside inserted, for if you incise it, it will contract and enter into the flesh and cause an abscess and corruption in the area and a bad ulcer.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	Because the abscess must be treated vigorously and extracted little by little, until it is completely expelled from the rear of the patient, and no cause should affect the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein, some men have been incised whose length is about five palms and I have been informed that one was incised measuring twenty palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised at the time of its medication, then insert the probe into the wound and perforate that long tract through the body, until all that is in the matter is evacuated, and administer putrefaction to the area for several days with medicines; and then treat it according to the cure of abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has bumps, especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or in the foot, and blood flows into it through several openings, each of which is like that.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And therefore treat it thus as we have said in the division and what was said above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Of the section on worms generated under the skin and it is called bovine sickness.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This sickness is named in some lands as the bovine disease or gout, because it often affects cows and a few worms live in them, which are native between the tendon and the flesh, and go up and down throughout the body, and are shown by their own movement from one member to another, breaking the tendon and coming out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And its generation is through the putrefaction of some humors, just as worms and snakes and worms (lombrics) and ascarids occur in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared because of its malice, for when it goes into the body and rises to the head, and affects the vein, then greatly inflames it and enters and destroys the vein, and thereby often causes bumps.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And when you want to cure it and extract it, then do not proceed without considering its natural movement and appearance in relation to the sensation, then confirm that you have what is above it and what is left of it with liement and strong constriction, and dry it thoroughly before extracting it.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is found in the flesh and you do not find it, then place a cautery on fire over the area where it resides, and the main fear is corruption of it, which corrupts the area as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	If you find it spreading to the head near the neck, then apply strong constriction over the supraclavicular area, and dry it thoroughly, then extract it; and confirm that the illness uses modification of its body through medicines that evacuate corrupt bad humors, and avoid foods causing putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Of the section on the disease of gout.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This illness is called gout in our land, and it is a pain that occurs in some limbs, and often is passed from one limb to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And now I will describe that according to which I will treat it.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was summoned to a sick woman at a village, and upon examining her arm, I found a small swelling in the vein network of the arm. After an hour, that swelling moved upward like vermicelli boiling, though less urgently than porridge, appearing as if it were living silver moving from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then the pain in that area increased, and a hard lump formed in the muscle. Soon after, it stayed there for about an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then it also appeared in the other arm, moving to the opposite side of the body.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then I was advised that she should move her body thoroughly. It was marvelously surprising to see the change and the rapid movement from one limb to another.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had already seen this before in my hands in that manner, but I have observed movements where the pain is perceived to be permuted from one limb to another.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But not all have heels as in women.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I do not consider this to be the case, but rather because the woman was of an emaciated body with dry organs and veins exposed, and in this appearance there is a sensation of that swelling changed.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that this backward curvature not appear in those who are fleshy and have moist organs with enlarged veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And since you want the healing of the foot, and the patient feels that pain, when it does not appear as apparent as we have said regarding the heel, then firmly press on that area and slightly and gently place something over it where the swollen vein has subsided, and cauterize the area.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see it at the base of the heels, then cure that by releasing the body and by what you expel the swelling, and purge those with foul-smelling pills and with snake-root pills and similar.
De extraccio de sagetas.	For the extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diverse according to the species, and according to the locations in the body where they lodge. The diversity of these lies in those that have large points, small ones, concave ones, and silent ones, which are solid; and those that have three angles, and those to which belong tongues; and those to which belong feathers.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the members and feet where they lodge is according to two manners: for the members or are principal causes, thus like the brain, the heart, the liver, the lungs, the intestines, the bladder, and their like; and therefore when it lodges in any of these members and appears to you signs of death, which cause I will relate closely, then cover that arrow in those where death is at that in the major dispositions, and when to you do not appear these evil signs, and the arrow is not hidden in the depth of the member, then you extract that and cure the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And of the signs of apoplexy, when it lodges in the brain, and pierces through the bone, and is situated above the ventricle which is over the brain, for it happens by sudden violence, dizziness, and nausea, and redness and inflammation of the tongue, and spasms and confusion of understanding, and vomiting of bile, and much weakness, the word is cut off and the voice destroyed, and is situated at the site of the wound a white moisture resembling dust, and its appearance similar to the humidity of flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And therefore if you see these signs, then abstain from the cure and extraction of the arrow, unless it is outside.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	And the signs of the arrow when it strikes in the heart are that it is close to the left nipple, and one feels a hard lump there which is not visible; and the movement of the arrow seems like the pulse, and the flow of the dark black blood, and the coldness at the extremities, and the shiver, and the syncope; and therefore you would know that death descends upon him wholly.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrow has pierced the lung are the spitting of foamy blood from the wound, and the vessels near the neck are pulsating, and the color of the patient has changed, and he breathes heavily or gasps for air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow strikes in the periosteum which is in the foot, and the pain then is near the small bones, and causes a great and violent pain along with heavy breathing, and not all the muscles are affected.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if you press on the arrow in the stomach, then strongly apply a leaf of undigested food.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if you press on the arrow in the stomach, and it is embedded there, apply a leaf of undigested food to the wound, or the tissue, or intestine which is disrupted, and there is no hope for its cure without extracting the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow pierces the bladder and exits through urine, and the process of it causes pain in any part outside, then strongly feel pain in the thigh, know that it is fatal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	Moreover, the other limbs such as the face, neck, shoulder, arm, helper bone, dorsal vertebrae, furcula, and coxa, along with their counterparts of the limbs, are saved according to the major disposals when the arrow does not find a vein or artery and is not a venomous arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will recount to you what I have seen about the nature of these arrows, so that you may understand it regarding their cure.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The cause is that in a man an arrow struck the eyelid of his eye at the root of his nose, and I extracted it from one side, left his ear gray, and he recovered, and was not injured in his eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I extracted another arrow from a Jew which struck him in his eye at the gray of his eyelid, leaving the eyelid but removing the arrow which was partially hidden and could not be retrieved except for a small extremity attached to its shaft, and it was a large arrow among the sharp arrows of the Turks, embedded in iron lion where there were no ears.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew is intact, and was not injured in his eye at all.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another arrow from a Christian man which was embedded in the shoulder, and it was an Arabic arrow, and that is the one with ears; then I incised over it between two bones, and it was submerged in his shoulder; then I touched it delicately, and soon extracted it, and the Christian recovered.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And extracted another arrow from a man which was embedded in his abdomen, and observed that he died from that; therefore, after passing thirty days and no change occurring due to his condition, incised over the arrow and removed it, and he was healed, and no ill happened to him.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And there was a man in whom an arrow had struck his side, and the wound had healed over. After approximately seven years, incise the arrow near the hip.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And there was a woman to whom an arrow had struck her abdomen, and the wound had healed inside her, and no change occurred in her bodily functions, and the woman did not experience any discomfort during her operations.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And there was another man to whom an arrow had struck his face, and the wound had healed, but the arrow remained broken, not causing any additional pain, and he appeared much like this.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And extracted the arrow from the king's prince, who had an arrow wound in the middle of his nose, and it had already shifted slightly to the right nostril, with the entire arrowhead hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called for the cure of him near the arrow wound within three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then you examine the wound of the arrow closely; and then you inquire about the one that feels subtle, and does not feel it; but he felt the puncture and left his right ear, and then you suspect that this puncture was at the tip of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And apply the place to be applied where there is an attractive and digestive virtue, trusting that the place we apply it so that the location of the arrow appears to me, to dry up there.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And do not neglect the significant place where the arrow hit; and continue applying the plaster over it for several days without neglecting anything; and meanwhile, the wound consolidates, and you treat the malaise from the extraction for a period of several days until one day I feel the arrow inside its sheath and this happened to me.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then place a sharp corrosive medicine on the wound for several days until it burns; and over the surface, touch it, and examine the tip of the arrow, which adheres to the shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And then you adjust the incision of the wound with that sharp medicine where I visibly see the tip of the arrow appear, and pass to my time through the space of time between four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And then, when the wound is sufficiently enlarged, and it is possible for me to insert the forceps into it, I enlarge that area, and without using any other instrument, I do not cease to refine and invent methods for this, until one day I managed to grasp that with descending forceps made according to the form which will be described at the end of this chapter; then I extracted it; and then I restored that wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some doctors judged that the cartilage of the nose is not restored, but I restored that and the wound was consolidated, and the patient recovered completely, and no scar remained in any cause.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recount to you the quality of extracting some arrows, so that you pause and consider this rule and meaning of what I have not said, for the parts of this art and the definitions of those are not understood in the narrative nor do they comprehend those freely.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the wise craftsmen compare a little on motion; and from what is present to what is absent; and find new operation and new instrument for the descent of foreign causes when they occur.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore I say that arrows are not removed from the members in which they are embedded but according to two methods: either by attraction of the place into which they entered; or by the opposite part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is removed by the place into which it entered, or the arrow proceeding into a fleshly place and being shot out.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if it does not obey the guess of the hour at which it entered, then you must leave it for a few days until the flesh around it can heal, and the attraction and its exit can be alleviated.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And similarly, if it is embedded in bone and does not obey your guess, then leave that for a few days and apply attraction and movement to it each day, and it will be removed.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if you do not obey your attempt for several days, then you must puncture in the circuit of the arrow at that site of any part traveling subtly where the location is enlarged by the arrow.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is lodged in the bone of the head and has already pierced one of the ventricles of the brain, and appears in the patient several days later from those accidents which you call, then avoid the extraction of the arrow and leave it where its being equilibrates for several days; or if the arrow reaches the brain, then death is not prolonged for him.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is not lodged in the bone of the body only and does not pass into the brain, but remains in the patient for several days, and you do not encounter any causes of those accidents, then you proceed with the extraction of the arrow and treat it.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if it is firmly lodged and you do not obey your extraction, then you administer travels in the circuit of the arrow as we have recommended, and proceed to cure the area until it is healed.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	But if the arrow is already hidden in the place of the body and hidden from sensation, then you inquire about that area with your hand, and if you feel it, then remove it with some instruments which are suitable for its extraction.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot reach it due to the depth of the wound and the length of the arrow, and here there are neither nerves nor veins, then you cut into the wound when it is enlarged and it is possible to extract the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if it is in the ears where it is lodged, then you incise the flesh in which it is embedded as much as possible with all the skill you can muster; and use your ingenuity, if you cannot extract the flesh from the fracture of the ears or in torsion of those parts.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you administer the extraction of the arrow in any location, then you use your hand in a twisting motion with forceps at all parts where it complies; and with great subtlety so that the arrow is not broken and that it be made easy for its extraction and for this procedure.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot operate on that side of your turn, then you let it be for some days until the parts that are in the circuit of him heal, and then again operate on that which is alleviated.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	And if it causes you contrary condition of pain, then you administer what we have said about treatment in its chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And preserve your virtue in the incision of veins or nerves, or cords, and administer ease in every manner for the avoidance of the arrow; and do this with facility, tranquility, and slowness as I have recommended.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore make the arrow contract by itself that the patient be according to the figure according to which you fix the end of the arrow in him, for this is more advantageous.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	And if this is not possible for you, then administer what is possible for you according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	And for the arrows that are forced in contrary to the other part, or that you have already treated some part of them externally, or increase the swelling at the end of the arrow by the sensation of the part more above the thigh; then you extract from there; and the extraction is according to the quantity in which the forceps take hold; and then remove it, for it should be made light with evisceration.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	But if it is retained in the bone, then twist the bone according to the contrary direction where the arrow presses on the bone, and expand it by inserting, and then extract it.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	But if not, leave it for a few days, and then reinsert it where it pierced.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	But if the shaft of the arrow is there, then push it into place.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	But if the shaft is embedded and you want to administer an impulse, then insert it there. If it resists, stir it around with a curved instrument so that the concavity of the instrument enters the groove of the arrow, and then push it in.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	But if the arrow is curved, then push it with strong stirring into it, so that the arrow straightens out from it.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is poisoned, then make sure you draw out all the flesh in which it is located, as much as possible, and then treat it with what is appropriate.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the arrow hits the foot, or the belly, or the bladder, or the side, and is close enough that you can touch it with your hand, then dry it over that area where you touched it, and guard yourself from cutting a vein or nerve, extract it, and later apply a dressing to the wound while it heals.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	The form of forceps with which arrows are extracted:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	If the ends are like the beak of a bird and are made such that they grip the arrow when placed over it, so as not to let go.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And these forceps are made of special types, large, few, and medium-sized, according to the size of the arrow and its smallness, and the width of the wound, and the shape of it.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	The form of the concave trough at this end is made like the beak of a bird so that it aids in extracting the arrow from the wound, and presses against the dull part of the arrow.
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Form of pressing a deaf extremity:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	Thus, in order that the instrument may be eased into the concave arrow and be pressed thereagainst.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	From phlebotomy of the veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins for phlebotomy from which it is customary to bleed, located in the sixteenth chapter, are two pulsating veins near the ears, called by Alhasisain; two herbs that are prominently visible on the temple regions; and two veins near the tear ducts of the eyes, called aspirants; one vein in the middle of the forehead, and one vein at the extremity of the nose; two guidegus (or jugular) veins at the neck; two veins on the upper lip; and two veins on the lower lip; — these are the veins called algelic;— and two veins behind the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	But the veins that are phlebotomized in the arms are five; of which one is cephalic and is of the wild ivy; the people call it “the vein of the head,” sorda (deaf), and it is a median vein, composed of one branch from the basilica and another from the cephalic; they call this public one “the vein of all the body,” while the basilica is the vein that is located in the domestic ivy and is called “citillar,” and the vulgar ones call it “the vein of the belly”; the funis (or superficial) branch, which is located on the brachial artery and is applied over the elbow, is the one in which phlebotomy is performed, and it is the one that appears above the wrist through a clear manifestation. The salvatella (or transverse vein), which is the vein between the aforementioned auricular and the smaller one, is located on two branches.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	In the foot and thigh there are three veins; one of them is that which gives curvature to the curve of the wild vine; and the second is sophena, and its place is in the groin of the domestic animal; and the sciatic vein, and its place is in the curve of the wild vine; and in the thigh are other veins similar to those.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The condition of the veins near the ears is catarrhs, migraines, headaches, and old ulcers of the head.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the quality of sowing those is as I will recount to you: it should be rubbed on the head of the patient, and the head of the patient should be rubbed at the back of the skull in the place of both veins with a wide cloth with good friction; then firmly press the patient's side with a band where the two places of their veins are close to the ears in two pressed areas of the head; and you want that on your right hand, and if you feel the pulse of those on your right hand, here sow it by test.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Then take the surgical lancet, which is the one that will be inserted, and place it near the vein between where the bloodletting will reach the mouth.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And then raise your hand to the vein and its parts above, incise the vein with an oblique incision.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And let the length of the incision be the width of two fingers adjusted or near to that; and let the blood flow out as much as you wish.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then strengthen with powders and leave that there until it is healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And this has already been described at the beginning of the book regarding the incision and their cautery.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	More of the two arteries that are adjacent to the temple for the youth of bloodletting, it is an ancient and wicked headache, as well as chronic conjunctivitis and a body full of acute effusions in the veins.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the quality of bloodletting there is as I will recount to you: tighten the patient's neck with your hand between which the two veins appear by clear perception, and let the pulse of their wrist be felt by your thumb; and then you can proceed.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And then you elevate the codena above the vein at the parts superior to what you have just indicated, and insert the flebotomy incidentially leaving it there, elevate the vein in them; and cut that as you have done in the two other veins; and let the blood flow according to the quantity of your necessity.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then release the constriction of the patient's abdomen, and place your hand over the vein for an hour, and then place a cloth and powder there with a strong compression, and leave it until it is healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	And after the recollection of their symptoms, and following that, the incision, and the puncture at the beginning of the limb.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	And the procedure for bleeding from the vein of the forehead is similar to the cephalic venous bleed in ancient maladies of the face, including headaches, inflammation, and foul ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the quality of the bleeding from the forehead is as I will recount to you; it is that the patient strengthens his neck with a bandage under which the vein appears; and then take the instrument which is named a fossor, this is its form:
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Pause the puncture at the point where it is at the top of the cavity above that vein and strike over it either upright or for another cause in the manner of it, and let the blood flow according to the quantity you wish; then remove the perforation in the patient and strengthen it so that it may heal.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	Sometimes the space is opened by venesection on the side, but I do not know if the venesection should be of acute extremity as with other venesections, or of lateral extremity, and perform the venesection across the bone, for it is close by and strong; breaking the bone with the venesection when it is too delicate.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	More importantly, the youth of the two veins that are at the corners of the eyes through the eyebrow due to redness and swelling in the eyes, and for facial ailments.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	The quality of the venesection is that the patient's pulse strengthens with a cloth bandage, and then perform the venesection on those veins, and you stand over the head of the patient.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	And perform the femoral incision along the transverse direction for a short length, just a little, as in that place there is no flesh; and if the incision is fine, strengthen the extremity of it to be broken.
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then let the blood run until it is necessary, place your hand over those points, strengthen them for one night, and then remove them.
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	More importantly, the femoral incision of the vein in the nose is appropriate for acute fever and intense thirst, as well as facial illnesses, migraines, and rash that occurs on the face, especially when it is chronic.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	And the quality of the femoral incision is that the patient strains his neck, and then places his nose to your left hand, takes the fine long incision tool, and places it in the middle location of the nasal tip according to the correct direction, for the vein does not appear here, and thus the blood begins to flow quickly.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	Gently close the incision with your hand and let the blood flow as necessary; then remove it after one night, for it is restored somewhat quickly.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	May the youth of the femoral incision lead to constriction of veins and to the beginning of leprosy and various ill health conditions and bad corrosive ulcers similarly as with phthisis.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	And the quality of the femoral incision is that the patient feels each cut in his side with flax; and the surgeons are over the head of the patient, and the patient sits on a bench.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	And gradually make the femoral incision along the length with a femoral incision that is initially ample but becomes smaller and smaller; and extract blood according to the season, a certain quantity, or according to what is necessary; and make it similar to the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	And gradually remove the flax and firm up the two veins with a mid-string tension so that the patient is not overheated, and leave enough space in the wound for the plague to heal.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And the benefit of the femoral incision for the Algeric veins, it brings relief from small abscesses and pustules in the mouth, corruption of the gums, bad ulcers, and fissures, as well as bad ulcers that occur in the nose and around it.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the quality of the femoral incision is that you make a cut in front of the malae, and strengthen its neck with a bandage, then rotate the labia and look for two veins, one on the right side of the labia and the second on the left; the demonstration of each is by the blackness of each of both, and this more so is in the circuit of those small black veins; then incise each by an incisive cut.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	And if doubt remains to you, and you do not know which is which of those, then understand the incision of the larger one of those, and that which is more evident among them.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And make the appearance of the two veins that are in the labia above.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	And it is customary to incise both veins that are in the labia.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	And of the two veins that are left, the treatment for the tongue is close to the femoral incision at points that are in the groin, for the illness of the uvula, and for illnesses of the mouth.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	And the quality of performing a femoral puncture is to follow the patient's thighs in front of their groin, elevate the vein from below, and observe the vein, noting one side of it turning black and the other side turning black, noting the color change of each.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	And then perform a femoral puncture on each side; and beware that you do not end the procedure by mistakenly puncturing arteries, for they are close to the surface.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your veins that are punctured in the crotch are those in which blood usually flows in all men, and the femoral puncture is performed according to two methods: either place a thorn or olive needle of fine thickness; or use a surgical knife for the puncture, and call it a nessel. This is the form of it:
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And this nessel is to incise carefully and of those specific thin halves according to the width of the veins and the structure of those veins.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Form of femoral puncture with a thorn:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	Let the wound be as you see, and it is necessary to open the concave veins full of large apparent flowing vessels, and at those that contain thick turbid blood.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	This is the method for phlebotomy in olive patients:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this phlebotomy is of lesser breadth and finer extremity, and it is suitable for the phlebotomy of fine veins containing thin yellow blood.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	More so, the youth of the phlebotomy from the basilic vein, which is one of three veins: from which we extract the blood of the maladies that are left to the gualayro and the col, and from what affects the foot, the belly.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it is necessary for the phlebotomist, when performing this phlebotomy, to handle it well and be overly cautious with it, for if he leaves an artery there, and if he err and adjust the puncture of the phlebotomy improperly, he will cut that artery and cause flows of blood. Therefore, you must not perform a strong phlebotomy before cutting as with a lancet.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilica does not appear by clear manifestation, then change to the other one, or seek some branch there; or perform a flebotomy in that place at the end of the arm, for that is manifest; and dry that with a flebotomy as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	And if you wish the flebotomy of the metysse, then before the stricture of the arm, touch the place between where you know the location of the pulse, and then place your hand over it; then raise the arm and dry the vein with a concave section of the flebotomy as we have said; and guard that the percussion does not occur in any space of the location of the artery.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you observe, as you strengthen the ligament, inflammation occurs in the place you marked with your hand; that inflammation is due to the artery, so avoid that area.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.
